author: jwasinger
content: One argument against SSZ is backwards compatibility:  If we introduce an SSZ BAL with a fixed 16 byte balance, we immediately deprecate support for any existing private testing chains and forks which have any accounts with a larger balance.  If we use RLP, we can retain support for large balances because the encoded balance size is dynamic.

author: jwasinger
content: Also worth noting that based on analysis of 50 mainnet blocks, SSZ adds a ~10% size overhead vs RLP.
